intro: Calandrinia angulata, commonly known as the angular portulaca, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Portulacaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and vibrant, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to dry conditions. Its flowers, which are usually pink or red, bloom in summer and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Calandrinia angulata is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its drought tolerance and aesthetic appeal.
